SDE 2 [Proficiency in at least one object-oriented programming language (e.g., Java, C++, Python, C#), Data structures and algorithms, Software design principles (SOLID, design patterns), Version control (Git), Testing methodologies (unit testing, integration testing), Debugging and troubleshooting, Databases (SQL, NoSQL), Problem-solving, Communication skills (written and verbal)] [This will vary greatly depending on the company and specific role, but common examples include: Spring (Java), .NET (C#), React, Angular, or Vue.js (JavaScript), Node.js (JavaScript), TensorFlow or PyTorch (for Machine Learning roles), Specific cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)]

HR [Spreadsheet software (e.g., Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets), Database management (basic SQL knowledge helpful), Data analysis (basic statistical skills beneficial), Word processing (e.g., Microsoft Word, Google Docs), Presentation software (e.g., Microsoft PowerPoint, Google Slides), Email and calendar management] [No specific programming frameworks are typically required for an HR role.  The skills listed above are sufficient for most HR tasks.  While some advanced HR analytics roles might utilize data science frameworks like Python (with libraries like Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn) or R, this is not a general requirement for HR professionals.]
doctor None None

software engineer Programming languages (e.g., Java, Python, C++, JavaScript, C#), Data structures and algorithms, Object-Oriented Programming (OOP), Databases (SQL, NoSQL), Version control (Git), Testing methodologies (unit testing, integration testing), Debugging, Software design principles (e.g., SOLID), Problem-solving, Communication skills This heavily depends on the specific software engineering role (web development, mobile development, data science, etc.).  Examples include:  Spring (Java), React, Angular, Vue.js (JavaScript), .NET (C#), Django, Flask (Python), TensorFlow, PyTorch (machine learning), Node.js (JavaScript), Android SDK (Android development), iOS SDK (iOS development).  There are many more, and the relevant ones will vary widely.

java teacher Java, Object-Oriented Programming (OOP), Data Structures and Algorithms, SQL,  Testing frameworks (JUnit, Mockito), Git,  Software design principles, Debugging, Problem-solving Spring (basic understanding is helpful), Hibernate (basic understanding is helpful),  Servlet, JSP (optional, depending on curriculum)
